Reviews.Title: “A suitable stay in Streatham”
Reviews.Author: LinSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This was our second vist to the Leigham Court Hotel, to visit family in the area. The hotel is undergoing renovations but we stayed in the peaceful extension at the rear of the building. The triple-bedded room was clean, comfortable and had a view over the lawned garden. We saw a fox visiting the garden as we did on our previous visit. The staff were very pleasant and breakfast, served in the dining room at the front of the building was good and served promptly. The hotel is conveniently located for the 5 minute walk to Streatham Hill rail station and buses pass the door. There are plenty of bars, restaurants and shops a few minutes away on Streatham High Road.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tupelo70
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise, I`ve worked in South London for quite a few years and have not come across this place before.Easy check in, plenty of parking spaces for vans,warm and clean rooms and early, but just ok breakfast. It`s not really a 4 star score but compared with others in the area it deserves it. A short walk from Streatham train station,and the High street with a few pubs and restaurants. Good contractor digs.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in South London”
Reviews.Author: khbeard
Reviews.Content: The cost of the room was similar to other budget hotels in the area, but the value was much better. It is less than 5 min. walk to Streatham Hill station with easy access to Victoria Station downtown. Staff was very friendly with late check in not a problem. Rooms were very clean and the maids were very accommodating to our sleeping late as a result of jet lag. They have a number of rooms that sleep 3 or 4 people at a very reasonable price which is a bonus for families. Breakfast was typical but good. Very quiet and since we were there over Thanksgiving it was great that they were not stingy with the heat. We will definitely stay here again. They get booked faster than you would think, so reserve early.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Leedstravellers
Reviews.Content: I have given this hotel 4 stars not because it is a 4* hotel in the usual sense but because for a budget hotel it is excellent value for money and I would definitely stay there again. We wanted a reasonably priced hotel in this part of London and had a two night stay. Our room in the extension was a good size, very clean and comfortable and the bathroom, which had a shower but no bath, was modern and very clean.It was very quiet with no road noise. I liked the fact that the long passage to the room was wood look flooring rather than carpet which can soon look dirty in some cheaper hotels. The cooked breakfast which you order when you arrive at breakfast was freshly cooked and the bacon delicious. It arrived very quickly and the breakfast staff were very efficient. The continental breakfast is a bit dull,(boring cereals and not very nice yoghourts and only white bread) but the rate for the hotel was so reasonable you cannot expect gourmet food. We used buses to get to every where we wanted to go as we had our bus passes and we enjoy the journey to town even though it can be slow in the traffic. However if time is important then it is very near the railway station. Niggles - only one towel and one pillow each provided - perhaps could have asked for another but didn't try and no bath mat and I found it slippery on the tiles. There is no telephone in the room and the hotel one was out of order but since most people have mobile phones this is not really a problem. All in all a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Second visit did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: debandrich
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel just under a year after our first visit and found it equally excellent in terms of value for money, cleanliness and proximity to London. Free car parking is a bonus and the continental breakfast is plentiful if a tad uninspiring. You can order a fry up for a modest price if you want. For a cheap overnight break or short stay this is an excellent establishment.

Reviews.Title: “good no nonsens hotel in South London”
Reviews.Author: CLANANCH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (room 331, facing the main building) for 3 nights during our trip trough England. Room, beds, bathroom and breakfast are OK. Nothing to be exited about, nothing to complain. Some remarks: - room was quiet: no travic noise. But corridor can be noisy. - we had a triple room. Double bed + single bed. Double bed is relatively small (1.40m) - during our stay is was cloudy and cool. Many rooms have a flat room. Probably very warm during a hot summerday. There is no airco in the room (however there is a fan and it is possible to open the windows) - free car park. - 5 minute walk to Streathem hill station, 15 minutes to London Victoria by train. Special remark: two young foxes were playing at the lawn.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel within easy reach of central london”
Reviews.Author: tabithacat
Reviews.Content: What a find! Two minutes walk to Streatham station with 14minute link to Victoria. Or - if you get there early afternoon, FREE parking! Buses to Clapham Central past the hotel regularly. Hotel has 80 rooms but is very quiet . . welcoming helpful reception staff. Clean room, comfy bed, powerful shower. Hairdryer. Great for anyone wanted to stay, inexpensively, in London. Breakfast bit manic as you share long tables with whoever is around . . . average quality cooked breakfast but a continental option of ham, cheese, yoghurts etc. Only down side --- I would advise taking a Nescafe sachet from your room for breakfast coffee as the brew in the urn was like treacle!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and functional. Don't expect anything more!”
Reviews.Author: ProjectPete
Reviews.Content: This hotel 'did the job' when we needed somewhere to stay in London. The bed and toilet were clean enough, but strangely (as report by others too) it smelled like somebody was smoking in the room all night. I even put a rolled up towel against the bottom of the door, but that didn't seem to help. Breakfast was AWFUL. I won't say any more than that, but if you're staying here don't go near the breakfast room - just leave early and find somewhere else to eat. The price is still reasonable if you ditch the breakfast. All in all, it is a functional hotel. Don't stay here for a luxury break, stay here if you have to stay over somewhere and you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Its a clean b+b, front desk service is appalling as all the other reviews say. Room 242 19th march”
Reviews.Author: RobertD36
Reviews.Content: This is a good old fashioned b+b. It represents good value for money. Rack rate is 68, so no discount via booking.com. Its very near streatham hill rail and only 5 in a cab from balham tube on the northern. You cannot grumble for the money. Clean, large room. Tea/coffee/towels and hairdryer. Let's itself down by the appalling grumpy reception staff and handing remote controls out when you check in. Also you should assume all rooms are smoking as ash trays everywhere. Room is not the mandarin, but nor should you expect it for the price. If you want a better room pay the money. Did us fine for an after party stopover but if I was coming to london for a nice weeekend I wouldn't stay here

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: mitch44_10
Reviews.Content: I booked thi hotel as it was near to where some friends were having a reception, I wish I hadn't. On arrival the staff were extremely rude and unhelpful and pretended not to understand what I was saying (I gave up). No help was offered with my bags and there is no lift. Upon opening the door to my room I was nearly knocked out by the heat of the room and the stench of smoke in the room (which was strange as I had asked for a non smoking room). I saw little point in complaining due to the staffs attitude when I arrived. So in cold weather I found myself having to open the window and leave it open. There was no shampoo or shower gel so I asked reception where tesco was and they grunted and said there was a co-op down the road. In the morning a felt like a cup of tea unfortunately it was then that I noticed chewing gum stuck on top of the self. At this point I felt Physically sick and began to question the cleanliness of the room and left. As breakfast was included I thought there's no way they could go wrong with a piece of toast. Upon opening the door I was faced with a packed room full of long tables (bit like scout camp). The food looked foul and the staff couldn't be bothered to seat people. Needless to say I left with no food.

Reviews.Title: “pay extra to stay closer to london”
Reviews.Author: christhehulk
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel as we were on a budget. it really is a no frills hotel. while room was clean, bed and pillows were very uncomfortable.rooms and corradors are very noise, full conversations from other rooms can be heard. while all the staff working at breakfast were pleasent the food could have been better. a full english is advertised but only consists of cerals, toast and a hot breakfask of eggs, saussages and bacon. front of house staff elsewhere were not rude but not very friendly. a smile or a hello would go along way.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely room at a great price”
Reviews.Author: debandrich
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel for a one night stay close to the centre of London with free parking. This hotel was a real find - the price was unbelievably cheap yet the quality of the room and service first class. The breakfast was called 'continental' and to be honest was fairly rudimentary but cheerfully presented and plenty of it - just don't expect a fry up. Lovely coffeee, toast, cereals etc. We'll definitely use this hoetel again.

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly average, but reasonable value for money”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCorn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on a short break in London. Its location is reasonably close to Streatham Hill station for access to London's centre, and the free parking is excellent. My room was on the top floor, had a distinctly retro decor (but clean, so not a problem), and was swelteringly hot. Even with the window wide open all night, and the wall fan switched on, the temperature was around 25 Celcius. The bed was fairly comfortable, but the pillows rather hard. There was some hot-ish water in the morning, but when I showered in the afternoon, the water was cold. The staff were friendly and helpful on reception, but the breakfast was very poor. Avoid the processed cheese and reformed ham at all costs. All in all, the room was ok for the price I paid (£40 per night through alpharooms), but the temperature of my room and the breakfast let the hotel down.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL BUT NOISY AT NIGHT & BREAKFAST IS POOR”
Reviews.Author: hoelyshoe
Reviews.Content: This is a nice clean hotel. The only negatives were being awoke at about 5am with all this noise for a hour including a couple bonking and a poor breakfast. There were about 5 breakfast staff on duty and between them they didnt come up with very much and a few done more cleaning than anything else. One of the staff had some bad habits and should not be working with food. I soon left the dining room. Overall it was a nice hotel though: its clean, secure and well presented.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but excellent value and everything you need”
Reviews.Author: TravellerSA22 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: If you want a reasonably affordable hotel in London which is clean with functional facilities and gives a basic but good breakfast this is a good choice. After some minor issues with the bathroom we were treated very friendly and prompty moved to another room (without even have to carry our luggage). Everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but avoid the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: sweeties1975
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and excellent parking facilities as I had a LWB Transit also had 3 coaches parked there too.Clean spacious room which were at a high standard with a nice view of a sprawling garden to observe squirrells! I avoided the breakfast after the first day due to asking for poached eggs on toast,and the lady coming over and proceeding to dump a full English on the plate which looked very shabby.My work mates experienced this all throughout the week.Said that I reccommend this hotel for workmen with vans as the parking on the street is a mare,just avoid the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “clean place to stay but noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: ayeisha
Reviews.Content: hotel was very clean and the staff helpful. the room was nice and well kept, but the walls never kept out any noises from next door. you could hear everything, from people going in and out of their wardrobe to people having a shower. when we went down to breakfast, it was very disapointing indeed. you had to help yourself, and the lady cooking the breakfast was doing unhygienic things, which i wont mention. the toast didnt taste of bread, and i left breakfast feeling it was not clean enough.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value and clean”
Reviews.Author: wanttogetawaymore
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a pleasant 2 night stay at Leigham Court. We were greeted by a friendly receptionist and directed to our room in the extention part of the hotel. The room, including the large bathroom, was very clean. We had booked a family room for 4. Our room was a triple with an extra bed but still adequate space in the room. It did get quite hot at night and we were pleased that there was a large fan in the room. Hotel was very easy to find - 2 minutes from Streatham Hill main line. We actually got a tube to Clapham Common and then a bus to Streatham Hill - 5 minute bus journey, buses every 10minutes. Bus stops outside hotel and it was quick and easy to get to centre of London on tube from Clapham Common. Cooked breakfast was good. There was also cereal, toast or ham+cheese (all of the 'value' type). Tables were in sets of 8 so we had to share with other guests but the tables were big so we didn't feel crowded. We've stayed in other similar priced hotels nearer central London and found the Leigham to be cleaner and more spacious than other 'quad' rooms we've stayed in. Because of its closeness to public transport we also found it more convenient for central London and Kings Cross ie. no 10 minute walks to tube stations with luggage. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: nagman
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel for 2days in 2007 and 2008,visiting wimbledon tennis championships. value for money was our theme,and this hotel provides that. rooms are clean and tidy but a bit dated,and the breakfast is a bit of a free for all,with long bench tables and "help you self". reminded me of the army mess,but nevertheless the food is ok,including the cooked breakfast. location is good,with plenty of parking space at the hotel. short walk to bus and train links to cental london. in short,you will have a job to find anywhere of this decent quality for the price.[we paid £30 a night each]

Reviews.Title: “was a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: vikkilou
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for 2 nights with our little 2 year old. The room was a god size and was comfortable.Felt unsafe to leave windows open as we the windows opened on to a roof which was easily accessable to others. windows was very high so we had no veiw outside. Other then that it was fine the breakfast was ok although they forgot about us on one day and it was half an hour wait.Was nice when we got it and was good size very satisfying for the day ahead. The staff where helpful and car park was good size got parked there easily enough although can get busy.My little boy got ceoliac disease and they where good working round this. Overal a good stay and we will use the hotel again as it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Family Rooms”
Reviews.Author: nuttypsycho
Reviews.Content: I booked a family room. When I arrived, just before 3pm, the room was not ready. Bearing in mind Check-in is at 2pm. The room consisted of a double bed and 2 single beds and spelt of stale cigarettes. One of the single beds was put up against the wardrobe, which meant that we had to move the bed to gain access to the wardrobe. My dad was booked into a double room, which was the same size as our 'family' room. I asked at reception if we could be moved into a different family room. I was informed that the hotel only had 2 family rooms. I don't advise families stay in this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “it's ok”
Reviews.Author: kirinhoney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine for this price, 30 pound per night. The reception during the night had a good manner and was helpful but the day shift wasn't friendly and helpful. The room was ok but the wall seem to be so thin. I could hear people who lived next door talked and could hear their TV. Even their phone vibrated at night, I could hear it just like it was in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, really!”
Reviews.Author: frequent-explorer
Reviews.Content: The counter staff have really bad manners! Rooms are small with an awkward layout. Reception is weak, so you can forget about tv.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy with roaming teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Pavement-Walker
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find, well sign-posted. They said that there would be room in the car park if we arrived before six and there was. We were in the extension at the back of the hotel, a long L-shaped corridor with single story rooms. Comfortable rooms and warm. Might have been very acceptable except for the 40 or so young teenagers from abroad who roamed the corridor, now a source of echoing noise, and gathered in various rooms until well into the small hours. The adult supervisors were obviously somewhere else in the hotel. The only alternatives to a boring cooked breakfast were corn flakes and white bread toast. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from Streatham Hill station which is also a major bus stop. The 417 bus runs from outside the hotel to Clapham Common. This could have been a good place to stay, at a modest price, but if they are targeting groups of young students and similar, to fill their rooms, you won't get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the hotel this year, same as last time. Brilliant service, lovely clean room, lots of tea and coffee, missed breakfast as overslept, but the first time round it was lovely so am sure it would have been again. Would definitely stay in this hotel again if I am in the area, we were there for a concert at Brixton Academy and it was a 5 minute bus ride away, very convinient. Well done! A budget hotel that isn't a total mess!

Reviews.Title: “Felt very safe and it was very clean”
Reviews.Author: pbeckw
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was very nice. Very secure and clean. Rooms were large and staff was extremely friendly. Breakfast was a fulfilling. Hard to find, but a good location after you find it, easy access to train travel.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No frills - This place really is just for sleeping and it fits its purpose perfectly. Have stayed a couple of times and recommend the rooms in the Annexe as they are better. Breakfast is fine; a basic full english, endless toast and hot /cold drinks, cereal or continental (I agree that the continental brekkie does leave a lot to be desired). Central heating seems to be a constant theme, it was permanently on during my latest stay although this is no bad thing at this time of year!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Jason42
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean but far too warm. My radiator thermostat was broken and I slept with the window open all night in Winter. Handy for the railway and the southern end of the Northern Line.Avoid the breakfast, esp the Continental (one slice of Dairylea, one slice of Tesco economy ham). Lots of places to eat (and some to drink) within 5 minute walk at Streatham Hill
